content.text: [A montage of scenes from TOW Ross and Rachel Take A Break follows.]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross is eating the picnic as Rachel comes home from work.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I mean, I don’t feel like I even have a girlfriend anymore.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You want me to just quit my job so that you can feel like you’ve got a girlfriend?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is this about Mark?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, it’s not, it’s not.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God. I cannot keep having this same fight with you Ross! Look, urrgh, maybe we should take a break.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine, you’re right. Let’s ah, let’s take a break, (goes to the door) let’s cool off, okay, let’s get some frozen yoghurt, or something.. (opens the door)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. A break from us.
(Ross looks at her, then leaves slamming the door behind him.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Mark is there, opening Chinese food boxes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Then, we had this big, stupid fight, and I said I wanted to take a break, I don’t want to take a break.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ve been thinking, this is crazy, I mean don’t, don’t you think we can work on this?

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Hey, what do you want to drink?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who’s that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nobody.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is that Mark?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm, honey, look he just came over to…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah! Got it! (slams down the phone)

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Hey, come dance. What? Are you married? ‘Cause that’s okay.
[Cut to Chloe and Ross dancing, and their kiss.]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is making a fruit drink in the blender, Rachel has just finished her shower and is coming out of the bathroom.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How’s the big anniversary dinner?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, we never actually got to dinner.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohhh, nice.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, we kinda broke up instead.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! (She accidentally starts the blender without the lid on it and fruit flies everywhere.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: God, Monica it’s on the ceiling.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s okay, this is more important than fruit (pause) (angrily) on my ceiling! You broke up?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, but it’s okay, because when Ross left Mark came over.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, you and Mark?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, no-no, it’s okay, calm down. Mark and I talked, and I realised how much I love your stupid brother, and, yeah, we got our problems, but I really want to make it work.

content.description: Ross’s Bedroom, Ross is waking up. He straightens himself out on the bed and puts the covers over his head.

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Morning!
(Ross sits bolt upright, without moving the covers.)

content.description: Ross’s Kitchen, Ross is taking some aspirin and checking his messages.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, it’s me. I’ve been trying to reach you all night. I feel awful. Please, Ross, you gotta know there is nothing between me and Mark. This whole break-up thing is just stupid.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Eh, I’m just so sorry I put you through it. And, I y’know, I don’t want to get back together over a machine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Na-huh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, I love you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I love you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And y’know what, I’m gonna, I’m gonna go to bed now, but ah, on my way to work tomorrow morning, I’m gonna stop by around 8:30.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. (Ross starts frantically looking for a clock.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bye.
(Ross finds a clock, sees it’s almost 8:30, and silently screams.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chloe, Chloe how’s it coming?!!

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Hey, what kind of puppy do you think I should get?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm, oh, hey, I don’t know. How about a big one?

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: But my apartment is so…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well then a small one!! Listen, let’s, we kinda have to get going!

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Wait! Where’s my shoes?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You, you sure you need shoes? (Chloe nods her head) Okay. (reaches down and picks up a shoe)

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Do I know why we’re rushing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, y’know the ah, the girlfriend I told you about last night? (He’s frantically throwing the cushions off of the couch looking for her other shoe) Well it turns out she ah, she wants to get back together with me. Oh, I found it!!

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: That’s so great for you guys!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: You must be so happy!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, yes I am, one of the many things I’m feeling. Well… (picks up her coat)

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Good luck, with your girlfriend.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, thank you. (She goes to kiss him, but he holds her coat up between their faces to stop her.) Hey, hey. (opens the door, sees Rachel, and hides Chloe behind the door) Rachel!!!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi. Ohhh, you got my message.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, oh hey, you are right on time.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So what do you say? Can I be your girlfriend again?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, you can, very much.
(Chloe gives Ross the thumbs up while still standing behind the door.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ahhhh!! (Hugs Rachel tighter.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is entering carry a large box, Monica is mopping the ceiling.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, why are you mopping your ceiling?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, there’s banana on it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow, I have the spirit of an old Indian women living in mine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So then you know? (Phoebe nods her head)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: The mailman was downstairs, so I brought up your mail.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, good. Thanks.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Now what is Fabutec?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, all right don’t judge me to much. Okay? Um, but I saw this info-mercial, and um, I swear to you I have never-ever bought anything on TV before, except for this mop. But there was this stuff on leg waxing, it just, it looked so amazing…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Waxine!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes! Have you seen it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, it’s incredible! I so want to be a Waxine girl.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: God. Do think it really doesn’t hurt? ‘Cause how can they do that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello! Organic substances recently discovered in the depths of the rain forest!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: They have the best stuff in there.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Ross has told Chandler and Joey his terrible act.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God! Oh my God!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. We figured when we couldn’t find you, you’d gone home to make up with Rachel. Which is probably what you shoulda done. Huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You think?! God, I, ah, I’m in hell. I mean what, what am I gonna do? Rachel’s all like, ‘I love you and, and let’s work on this.’ And all I can think about is, ‘What is she gonna do? What is she gonna say?’ when I tell her what I did.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, before we answer that, I think we should address the more important question. How dumb are you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! Look, we’re trying to rebuild a relationship here, right. How am I supposed to do that here, without being totally honest with each other?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, Ross look, I’m on board about this totally honesty thing, I am, just not about stuff that’s gonna get you in trouble.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He’s right. Nobody’s gonna benefit, and you’re just gonna hurt her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, and there won’t be a relationship left to rebuild.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, but don’t you think…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right look, if you absolutely have to tell her, at least wait until the timing’s right. And that’s what deathbeds are for.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, okay. (he plops down into one of the leather chairs, with the footrest extended.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, okay, now, we just have to make sure she doesn’t find out some other way. (spins the chair around so that Ross is facing him) Did you think about the trail?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What trail?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The trail from the woman you did it with to the woman you hope never finds out who did it! (slapping his hands with each word) You always have to think about the trail!
content.parenthetical: stomps on the footrest which pops Ross up into a sitting position

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I-I don’t think there’s any trail.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, okay-okay, ah, Chloe works with that guy Issac. Issac’s sister is Jasmine. And Jasmine works at that message place with Phoebe. And Phoebe’s friends with Rachel. And that’s the trail, I did it!

content.description: Monica’s Bedroom, Monica and Phoebe are waxing their legs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: After applying the Waxine and linen strips to leg number one,

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did that!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Grasp one of the linen strips by its ‘easy grab tab’ and pull it off in one quick pain free motion.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (Does so.) Ow!!!!! Ow-oh-oh!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Was it not pain-free?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No. It was painful. Oh my God , they should call it Pain-zine, now with a little wax.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Huh, well, the girls in the satin nighties on the commercial don’t seem to think it’s that bad.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s because their nerves are probably deadened from being so stupid. But hey, y’know if you don’t believe me, please, by my guest.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ow-ow-ow-ow! Oh my God!!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Now, are you glad we didn’t start with the bikini strips?

content.description: The Xerox Place, Ross is trying to break the trail.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chloe? Hi..

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Is this about me taking your watch?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You took my watch?

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: I’m sorry, I do that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just you keep it, listen did you, did you tell anyone about us?

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Oh no. I feel it isn’t really anybody’s business, y’know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Exactly. So you didn’t, didn’t mention anything to Issac right?

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Oh, well I tell Issac everything.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You tell, of course you do. Issac. Issac. Hey, Issac. Issac, hi! Y’know we haven’t actually met…

content.speaker: Isaac
content.text: You dog!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, I suppose I am a dog. But Issac, see I-I happen to have a girlfriend.

content.speaker: Isaac
content.text: Oh right, that Rachel chick from the coffee place.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, that’s the one. Listen, I don’t want to hurt her.

content.speaker: Isaac
content.text: Oh, hey, man I know, doesn’t matter how much we love ‘em, monogamy is too cruel a rule.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. Listen, can you keep this information to yourself?

content.speaker: Isaac
content.text: Aw, no problem dude. Y’know we got to look out for each other. We’re the same, you and me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Actually, no, we’re not.

content.speaker: Isaac
content.text: Yeah, we are.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, we’re not.

content.speaker: Isaac
content.text: Yeah, we are.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, we’re not!!

content.speaker: Isaac
content.text: Okay, we’re not.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Isaac
content.text: But, we are.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine. I just need to know that you’re not gonna tell your sister.

content.speaker: Isaac
content.text: I can promise not to tell her again.

content.description: Phoebe’s Work, Ross is now trying to stop Jasmine from telling Phoebe.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Jasmine?

content.speaker: Jasmine
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We met at Phoebe’s birthday party, I’m, I’m Ross Geller.

content.speaker: Jasmine
content.text: You did a bad thing!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, I did.

content.speaker: Jasmine
content.text: Very bad!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Very bad.

content.speaker: Jasmine
content.text: Very, very bad.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m agreeing with you. Did you, listen, did you happen to tell Phoebe yet?

content.speaker: Jasmine
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, Jasmine, please, please don’t. I love my girlfriend very much, and I want more than anything to just work it out with her. Okay?

content.speaker: Jasmine
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you, thank you.

content.speaker: Jasmine
content.text: But you should probably talk to my roommate, because I told him and he knows Phoebe too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who’s your roommate?

content.description: Central Perk, Gunther is wiping down the counter as Ross rushes in.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Gunther! Gunther. Gunther, please tell me you didn’t say anything to Rachel about me and the girl from the Xerox place.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: I’m sorry. Was I not supposed to?
(Ross turns around and sees Rachel sitting by the window. She is just glaring at him.)

content.description: Monica’s Bedroom, Monica and Phoebe are removing the rest of their wax strips.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ow!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ow!! Ow!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ow!!!

content.speaker: Monica and Phoebe
content.text: Ow!!!!!!! Ow-ow-ow-ow!
(Hearing the screaming Chandler and Joey rush in. Joey has a pan, Chandler has a tea kettle.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We’re all right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s okay, it’s okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We’re all right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We were just waxing our legs.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Off?!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: For your information, this happens to be a pain like no man will ever experience.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, well I don’t think you can make that statement, unless you’ve been kicked in an area that God only meant to be treated nicely.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I-I think that women just have a lower threshold of pain than men, that’s all. I mean, come on, it’s just a little wax.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah, come here. (Puts a little wax on Joey’s arm and puts a strip on it.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, that’s mature.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, fine, so now what, I just pull it off?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s right.
(Joey laughs, pulls it off, then does a high-pitched whine.)
[Cut to Living Room, Rachel is trying to close the door on Ross.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, Rachel, come on! Talk to me! Please!!
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom, Chandler slowly closes the door, and we hear Rachel from the living room.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can’t talk to you. I can’t even look at you right now!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nothing, nothing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel said everything was okay.
content.parenthetical: going over to listen at the door

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What, what are they talking about?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rachel?
[Cut to Living Room]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Just get away from me!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, it was a mistake! I made a mistake! Okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: A mistake?! What were you trying to put it in? Her purse?!
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Whe-where did he put it?!
[Cut to Living Room]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, you had sex with another woman!
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom, both Monica and Phoebe gasp.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I knew something had to be wrong, because my fingernails did not grow at all yesterday.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, well, I guess they had a fight, and he got drunk…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh!! (hits Chandler and Joey in the head) You guys knew about this and you didn’t tell us?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He has sex, and we get hit in our heads.
[Cut to Living Room]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know what, I want you to leave! Get outta here!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Just get out! Now!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No!! No!! I wanna stay. I wanna talk about this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay! All right! How was she?
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh-oh.
[Cut to Living Room]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Was she good?
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t answer that.
[Cut to Living Room]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on Ross! You said you wanted to talk about it, let’s talk about it!! How was she?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She was…
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Awful! Horrible!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She was not good. Not good.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She was nothing compared to you.
[Cut to Living Room]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She, she was different.
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ewwwww!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh-oh.
[Cut to Living Room]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good different?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nobody likes change.
(Rachel picks up a newspaper and starts beating him with it.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? Okay, okay, okay, okay.
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Should we do something?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, never cheat on Rachel.
[Cut to Living Room]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry, okay, I’m sorry. I wa-I was disgusted with myself, and this morning I was so, I was so upset and then I got your message and I was so happy, and all I wanted was to get her out of my apartment as fast as possible.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whoa!! Whoa, whoa, wait a minute. What time did your little friend leave? (Ross can’t answer that) Oh my God. She was there? She was still there? She was in there, when I was in there?!
(Ross hands Rachel back the newspaper, and she starts beating him with it again.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Listen. Oh hey, hey, the important thing was that she meant, she meant nothing to me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And yet she was worth jeopardising our relationship!!
(She throws the paper at him, misses and hits Monica’s door, they all jump back at the sound.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I didn’t think there was a relationship to jeopardise. I thought we were broken up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We were on a break!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That, for all I knew would, could last forever. That to me is a break-up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You think you’re gonna get out of this on a technicality?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I’m not trying to get out of anything, okay. I thought our relationship was dead!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, you sure had a hell of a time at the wake!
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know what, I don’t think we should listen to this anymore. (Goes to open the door)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What, what are you doing? You can’t go out there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why not?! (to Chandler) I’m hungry.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because they’ll know we’ve been listening.
[Cut to Living Room]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: God! And to have to hear about it from Gunther!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on! Like I wanted him to tell you, I ran all over the place trying to make sure that didn’t happen!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, that is so sweet. I think I’m falling in love with you all over again.
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what, I think we can go out there. I mean they have more important things to worry about.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, we’ll be fine.
[Cut to Living Room]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look Rachel, I wanted to tell you, I thought I should, I-I did, and then Chandler and Joey convinced me not to.
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wax the door shut, we’re never leaving, ever.
[Later, Phoebe is on the phone, they’re all still trapped in Monica’s bedroom.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi, it’s Phoebe. Listen someone’s gonna have to take my 9:00 with Mr. Rehack, ‘cause it’s like 9:15 now, and I’m not there.
[Cut to Living Room]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Don’t you realise none of this would’ve ever happened if I didn’t think at that same moment you weren’t having sex with Mark?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right. Let’s say I had slept with Mark. Would you have been able to forgive me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes I would.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’d be okay if you knew that Mark had kissed me, and been naked with me, and made love to me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You knew that our hot, sweaty, writhing bodies were…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: La-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la! Okay, okay, yeah, I would have been devastated but, I would still want to be with you. Because it’s, I mean it’s you.
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom]

content.speaker: All
content.text: Ohhhhh!
[Later, Ross and Rachel are sitting in the kitchen.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? Come on Rach, tell me what you’re thinking?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m thinking, I’m gonna order a pizza.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Order a pizza like, ‘I forgive you?’
(She turns around and glares at him, he turns away.)
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh man, pizza? I like pizza. (makes like he is trying to send a telepathic message to Rachel) Put olives on the pizza.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We could eat the wax! It’s organic.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh great, food with hair on it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, not the used wax.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because that would be crazy?
[Cut to Living Room]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, can I, can I get in on that? Because I’m kinda hungry myself.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Fine. (on phone) Hi! Yes, I’d like to order a large pizza.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No anchovies.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: With ah, extra anchovies.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s okay, I’ll just pick ‘em off.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, and could you please chop some up and just put it right there in the sauce?
[Cut to later, they are finishing up the pizza, there’s one piece left.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You can have the last piece, if you want.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I should think so. You slept with someone.
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom, they’re all eating the wax, Chandler and Phoebe, don’t like it. Joey tries some and makes a face like: ‘Hey, that’s not so bad.’]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: They’re gonna get through this, aren’t they?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, come on, it’s Ross and Rachel, they’ve got too.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What if they don’t?
(Long pause.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You think I need a new walk?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well y’know, I’ve been walking the same way since high school. Y’know, y’know how some guys they walk into a room and everybody takes notice. I think I need a ‘take notice’ walk.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you actually saying these words?
[Later, in the living room, Rachel is sitting on the couch, Ross is on the chair.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, now you’re not even taking to me? (moves over to the coffee table) Look Rachel, I-I’m sorry, okay, I’m sorry, I was out of my mind. I thought I’d lost you, I didn’t know what to do. Come on! Come on, how insane must I have been to do something like this? Huh? I-I don’t cheat right, I, that’s not me, I’m not Joey!
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa-ho-ho! (He looks at Chandler, who gives him a ‘come on’ look.) Yeah, okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey. It’s three in the morning. They don’t know that I’ve come home yet. You notice how neither one of them are wondering where I am.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, y’know, people can be so self-involved.
[Cut to Living Room]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what, y’know what, I’m-I’m not the one that wanted that, that break, okay. You’re the one that bailed on us. You’re the one that, that ran when things got just a little rough!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s what?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That is neither here nor there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, well here we are. Now we’re in a tough spot again, Rach. What do you want to do? How do you want to handle it? Huh? Do you wanna fight for us? Or, do you wanna bail? (sits down next to her) Look, I, (on the verge of tears) I did a terrible, stupid, stupid thing. Okay? And I’m sorry, I wish I could take it back, but I can’t. (We see Monica and Phoebe are almost in tears.) I just can’t see us throwing away something we know is so damn good. Rachel, I love you so much.
(He kisses her on her shoulder, then her neck, then the side of her face, then just before he kisses her on the lips…)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No Ross!! (stands up and moves away from him) Don’t! You can’t just kiss me and think you’re gonna make it all go away, okay? It doesn’t work that way. It doesn’t just make it better. Okay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay, okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I think you should go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I really think you need to go now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay. This morning you said there was nothing so big that we couldn’t work past it together…
content.parenthetical: moving over to stand in front of her

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, what the hell did I know!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, look, there’s got to be a way we can work past this. Okay, (takes a hold of one of her arms.) I can’t imagine, I can’t imagine my life without you. (Both of them are starting to cry.) Without, without these arms, and your face, and this heart. Your good heart Rach, (drops to his knees and hugs her around her waist) and, and…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. I can’t, you’re a totally different person to me now. I used to think of you as somebody that would never, ever hurt me, ever. God, and now I just can’t stop picturing with her, I can’t, (Ross stands up and backs away) it doesn’t matter what you say, or what you do, Ross. It’s just changed, everything. Forever.
[We see the rest of them are now crying.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, but this can’t be it, I mean.
(pause)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Then how come it is?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: They’ve been quiet for a long time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe she killed him?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Let’s go.

[Cut to Living Room, Rachel is sleeping on the couch, Ross is gone, the rest of them can finally emerge from their cell. They all wave good bye, and start to walk quietly out, as Monica goes and puts a blanket on Rachel. Joey starts walking all hunched over and bobbing his shoulders as he goes.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is that your new walk?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I really have to pee.
